title: Jating
author: Jating
content: https://www.habitat.org/support/cryptocurrency-donationsIt's now official, Habitat for Humanity International is accepting Bitcoin and other crypto as donations. So for those who have supported this non profit organization and you are a Bitcoin enthusiast, then this is another way to bring you donations in.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: That is very cool, although it is not an unusual thing nowadays.  Fortunately I have seen a lot of initiative from Bitcoiners to help out in many situations such as Venezuela and Ukraine.  I really do believe many of us here are well intended people.I never heard of this Organization before.  But generally speaking.  One thing in particular I do not like is how people enter lists of such Organizations to have a parasite kind of life style and leech off them.  It is why I rather support other initiatives or, my personal favorite, I rather just save up my own Money and do good deeds by myself.  This way I can choose some body who I know for sure needs the help I am offering.  But that may be just me.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: Well, I'd say that is a good idea and initiative for those who want to help other people, such as poor countries, and now many people have another option of helping or giving help to people in need, but I do hope that those who will handle this bitcoin donation thing know what they are doing because, of course, we know how complex bitcoin is, even converting into cash or what. Anyway, I also hope that this movement will be more implemented in different countries because I know many people or bitcoin investors who will want to help using their own assets. I'm sure this kind of movement will be implemented more if this first project is successful and if many people actually donate and give some of their assets. Anyway, I hope they could accept other crypto currencies or multiple coins so that many people will have other options for donating.

comments.author: Z-tight
comments.body: I don't know of the habitat for humanity international, i am just hearing of this organization for the first time, but it is great that they are now accepting donations in BTC and crypto. It is also usual nowadays to see BTC being used for purposes like these, because you can send BTC to any part of the world, fast and easy; and all the receiver needs is to create a BTC wallet address and make it available.Quote from: Assface16678 on June 18, 2024, 10:41:31 PMAnyway, I hope they could accept other crypto currencies or multiple coins so that many people will have other options for donating.They are not accepting donations in only BTC, but in a lot of other cryptocurrencies. You can check the donation page shared by the op for a list of all the cryptocurrencies they are accepting for donations.

comments.author: LDL
comments.body: Undoubtedly, this is an important step to spread the familiarity of Bitcoin around the world. However, if such important steps are taken in all countries of the world, Bitcoin will be known as one of the main means of payment in all areas of life in the future.However, it is very important to verify the authenticity of organizations that will accept payments through Bitcoin in the service of humanity. Because there are many fake companies who collect money from people in the name of services, in this case those companies collect money through various online payments.All those humanitarian organizations and organizations engaged in the service of the needy people are cheating like this based on the helplessness of people and these organizations should be vigilant so that they cannot collect money through Bitcoin. However, in the case of organizations that are certified by the government and various agencies, there can be no substitute for Bitcoin to collect money from different countries.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: When I was a little kid, the former president Jimmy Carter came to our province to build houses for a Habitat for Humanity village. That memory stuck with me until now. Little did I know that I too would be serving as a volunteer for the same organization a few years after attending university. I'm happy to hear this news. I'm happy for the organization being open-minded and futuristic. Not that I would be donating Sats since I've already donated no less than a whole year of my prime years to them, but I'm just happy that they're on our side.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: I do not know how this kind of action can help the Bitcoin ecosystem.  I am skeptical whether this action of the charity organization is to propagate the use of Bitcoin or they are just takin advantage of the Bitcoin currency to widen their scope of people where they can get the support for their activity.  I believe this organization will instantly convert the donated BTC to fiat currency the moment they received the transfer.On the other note, in a humanitarian view, it is great to have an easier way to support charities especially if the person is holding Bitcoin only as their fund.  They are saved from the pain of converting their BTC to fiat currency to reach out and donate to those charitable institutions.Quote from: armanda90 on June 19, 2024, 03:49:05 AMRecently I checked on the website of Habitat for Humanity not listed yet with bitcoin as option for donating, there are only have two payment method from Credit or Debit Card and PayPal for donating. I don't know with not update yet the payment donation trough bitcoin and other cryptocurrency coins or the Habitat for Humanity still make modify need more longer time to see bitcoin become their payment for donating. It is possible that the website of the said institution is in the process of integrating the Bitcoin donation system on their site.  Probably it will take some time to reflect the updated site where the address or the system for Bitcoin donation is visible.

comments.author: kryptqnick
comments.body: When the war hit my country, our charity organizations, as well as governmental military and humanitarian support institutions started accepting Bitcoin for donations in the first days of Russia's full-scale invasion. While many donated in fiat, donations in cryptos were also very significant. As of the middle of 2023, it brought $225 million worth of crypto donations. I'm sure that doesn't account for everything because we also have big individual volunteers collecting donations in cryptos, but they're unlikely to be included in stats like that.It's good when charities accept Bitcoin. It gives the crypto a reputation boost, and it helps collect money for good causes. It's a win-win. But Habitat for Humanity should add the crypto donation button into the general section of donations. Otherwise, it's very hard to even learn that it's an option, unless you already have the link you need.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Things like this were rare 8-10 years ago but now we see adoption increasing at a very fast rate, news like this breaks every day. Nether the less a big win for Habitat for Humanity International.

comments.author: atookz
comments.body: I have seen habitat for humanity near my city. As far as I know, it is a non-profit organization that helps build or repair houses to be decent. As far as I know, they also help families affected by natural disasters such as tsunamis, earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, etc. It is progress and a good thing if crypto is starting to be accepted by large non-profit organizations. This marks an important step in the mainstream adoption of crypto currency. This positive sentiment brings a wave of optimism among crypto industry players. I hope there are many other organizations that start to accept crypto, this will be a new era in the financial system and can change the way people think about crypto for the better.
